qas.question: Who did Eisenhower endorse for president in 1960?
Who was the Democratic candidate for president in 1960?
Who was the youngest person elected to the United States presidency?
Who won the US presidential election of 1960?

context: In the 1960 election to choose his successor, Eisenhower endorsed his own Vice President, Republican <a0_0>Richard Nixon<a0_0/> against Democrat <a1_0>John F. Kennedy<a1_0/>. He told friends, "I will do almost anything to avoid turning my chair and country over to Kennedy." He actively campaigned for Nixon in the final days, although he may have done Nixon some harm. When asked by reporters at the end of a televised press conference to list one of Nixon's policy ideas he had adopted, Eisenhower joked, "If you give me a week, I might think of one. I don't remember." Kennedy's campaign used the quote in one of its campaign commercials. Nixon narrowly lost to <a4_0>Kennedy<a4_0/>. Eisenhower, who was the oldest president in history at that time (then <a2_0>70<a2_0/>), was succeeded by the youngest elected president, as <a3_0>Kennedy<a3_0/> was 43.
